title: Item
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Item/zh-CN "Item/zh-CN")

An **item** is any carriable object to be found in the [dungeon](/wiki/Dungeon "Dungeon"). All items can be placed in your inventory, assuming they are not [too heavy](/wiki/Weight "Weight") for you to pick up, and they appear there under a number of categories, listed below. An **object** is a stack of one or more identical items that can be stored in a single inventory slot (though sometimes the term 'item' is erroneously used to refer to an object).

If the weight of the items you are carrying becomes too much then you become [encumbered](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance"). Items can be [blessed, uncursed or cursed](/wiki/BUC "BUC"), which affects their properties. Some have charges, and can be charged, most can be destroyed, some are generated randomly, and some are unique.

Many objects can pile up on top of each other on one [square](/wiki/Square "Square"), but only the symbol of the top one is shown.

## Item categories

- $ – [Coins](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")
- " – [Amulets](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet")
- ) – [Weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon")
- \[ – [Armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor")
- % – [Comestibles](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible")
- ? – [Scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll")
- \+ – [Spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook")
- ! – [Potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion")
- \= – [Rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring")
- / – [Wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand")
- ( – [Tools](/wiki/Tool "Tool")
- \* – [Gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem")/[Stones](/wiki/Stone "Stone")
- \` – [Boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder")/[Statues](/wiki/Statue "Statue")
- 0 – [Iron balls](/wiki/Heavy_iron_ball "Heavy iron ball")
- \_ – [Chains](/wiki/Iron_chain "Iron chain")
- . – [Venoms](/wiki/Venom "Venom")

[Dungeon features](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature") fixed to the floor, such as [altars](/wiki/Altar "Altar"), [fountains](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"), and [sinks](/wiki/Sink "Sink"), are distinct from items.

## Item generation

Items can be randomly found on the floor and in containers. An item is occasionally generated as a [death drop](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop") when [you](/wiki/You "You") kill a monster and it leaves a corpse. The probabilities below govern the generation of such random items, which varies depending on where they are generated:

| Item class                                     | Normal dungeon | Inside [containers](/wiki/Container "Container") | [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level") | [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") |
| ---------------------------------------------- | -------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- |
| [Weapons](/wiki/Weapons "Weapons")             | 10%            | 0%                                               | 12%                                            | 20%                                   |
| [Armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor")                   | 10%            | 0%                                               | 12%                                            | 20%                                   |
| [Comestibles](/wiki/Comestibles "Comestibles") | 20%            | 15%                                              | 22%                                            | 16%                                   |
| [Tools](/wiki/Tool "Tool")                     | 8%             | 0%                                               | 0%                                             | 12%                                   |
| [Potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion")               | 16%            | 18%                                              | 22%                                            | 1%                                    |
| [Scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll")               | 16%            | 18%                                              | 22%                                            | 1%                                    |
| [Spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook")      | 4%             | 12%                                              | 0%                                             | 0%                                    |
| [Wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand")                     | 4%             | 6%                                               | 5%                                             | 8%                                    |
| [Rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring")                     | 3%             | 5%                                               | 5%                                             | 8%                                    |
| [Amulets](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet")               | 1%             | 1%                                               | 0%                                             | 4%                                    |
| [Gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem")                        | 8%             | 18%                                              | 0%                                             | 10%                                   |
| Total                                          | 100%           | 93%                                              | 100%                                           | 100%                                  |

The other 7% of objects generated inside containers will be piles of gold.

In addition, some levels specify extra randomly-generated items: for example, each level of the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") contains at least one tool, and each [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") level contains a ring and a wand. [Monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") can also be generated with items in their [inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory").

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Item

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎

An item is any carriable object to be found in the dungeon. All items can be placed in your inventory, assuming they are not too heavy for you to pick up, and they appear there under a number of categories, listed below. An object is a stack of one or more identical items that can be stored in a single inventory slot (though sometimes the term 'item' is erroneously used to refer to an object).

If the weight of the items you are carrying becomes too much then you become encumbered. Items can be blessed, uncursed or cursed, which affects their properties. Some have charges, and can be charged, most can be destroyed, some are generated randomly, and some are unique.

Many objects can pile up on top of each other on one square, but only the symbol of the top one is shown.

Item categories

  • $ – Coins
  • " – Amulets
  • ) – Weapons
  • [ – Armor
  • % – Comestibles
  • ? – Scrolls
  • + – Spellbooks
  • ! – Potions
  • = – Rings
  • / – Wands
  • ( – Tools
  • * – Gems/Stones
  • ` – Boulders/Statues
  • 0 – Iron balls
  • _ – Chains
  • . – Venoms

Dungeon features fixed to the floor, such as altars, fountains, and sinks, are distinct from items.

Item generation

Items can be randomly found on the floor and in containers. An item is occasionally generated as a death drop when you kill a monster and it leaves a corpse. The probabilities below govern the generation of such random items, which varies depending on where they are generated:

Item class Normal dungeon Inside containers Rogue level Gehennom
Weapons 10% 0% 12% 20%
Armor 10% 0% 12% 20%
Comestibles 20% 15% 22% 16%
Tools 8% 0% 0% 12%
Potions 16% 18% 22% 1%
Scrolls 16% 18% 22% 1%
Spellbooks 4% 12% 0% 0%
Wands 4% 6% 5% 8%
Rings 3% 5% 5% 8%
Amulets 1% 1% 0% 4%
Gems 8% 18% 0% 10%
Total 100% 93% 100% 100%

The other 7% of objects generated inside containers will be piles of gold.

In addition, some levels specify extra randomly-generated items: for example, each level of the Gnomish Mines contains at least one tool, and each Sokoban level contains a ring and a wand. Monsters can also be generated with items in their inventory.

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.1. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

rawPage:
{{languages}}
An '''item''' is any carriable object to be found in the [[dungeon]]. All items can be placed in your inventory, assuming they are not [[Weight|too heavy]] for you to pick up, and they appear there under a number of categories, listed below. An '''object''' is a stack of one or more identical items that can be stored in a single inventory slot (though sometimes the term 'item' is erroneously used to refer to an object).

If the weight of the items you are carrying becomes too much then you become [[Encumbrance|encumbered]]. Items can be [[BUC|blessed, uncursed or cursed]], which affects their properties. Some have charges, and can be charged, most can be destroyed, some are generated randomly, and some are unique.

Many objects can pile up on top of each other on one [[square]], but only the symbol of the top one is shown.

== Item categories ==

<!-- The below list follows the inventory sort order of NetHack 3.6.6 -->

* {{yellow|$}} – [[Zorkmid|Coins]]
* {{cyan|"}} – [[Amulet|Amulets]]
* {{brown|)}} – [[Weapon|Weapons]]
* {{cyan|[}} – [[Armor]]
* {{brown|%}} – [[Comestible|Comestibles]]
* {{white|?}} – [[Scroll|Scrolls]]
* {{magenta|+}} – [[Spellbook|Spellbooks]]
* {{green|!}} – [[Potion|Potions]]
* {{red|<nowiki>=</nowiki>}} – [[Ring|Rings]]
* {{yellow|/}} – [[Wand|Wands]]
* {{brown|(}} – [[Tool|Tools]]
* {{lightgray|*}} – [[Gem|Gems]]/[[Stone|Stones]]
* {{white|`}} – [[Boulder|Boulders]]/[[Statue|Statues]]
* {{cyan|0}} – [[Heavy iron ball|Iron balls]]
* {{cyan|_}} – [[Iron chain|Chains]]
* {{brown|.}} – [[Venom|Venoms]]

[[Dungeon feature]]s fixed to the floor, such as [[altar]]s, [[fountain]]s, and [[sink]]s, are distinct from items.

== Item generation ==

Items can be randomly found on the floor and in containers. An item is occasionally generated as a [[death drop]] when [[you]] kill a monster and it leaves a corpse. The probabilities below govern the generation of such random items, which varies depending on where they are generated:

The other 7% of objects generated inside containers will be piles of gold.

In addition, some levels specify extra randomly-generated items: for example, each level of the [[Gnomish Mines]] contains at least one tool, and each [[Sokoban]] level contains a ring and a wand. [[Monster]]s can also be generated with items in their [[Monster starting inventory|inventory]].
